EMC Is in Merger Talks with Dell 
Dell Inc., the Texas-based personal computer and enterprise IT company, is reportedly in talks with EMC to acquire the storage giant in what could be the largest tech merger ever. It's unclear what portions of both businesses would be included in the deal. EMC has been under pressure to forsake its "federated" business model, which puts its core storage business and its 80% stake in VMware under the same umbrella, as well as the infosec company RSA and the Pivotal Labs consulting business. The value of EMC's stake in VMware alone is equivalent to at least half EMC's market cap. Dell, meanwhile, has also discussed spinning of businesses. The Wall Street Journal and The New York Times both reported the news last night. DraftKings CEO Jason Robins (courtesy photo). 
Jason Robins says DraftKings Can Regulate Itself, Stands by Employee 
CEO Jason Robins told the Boston Globe DraftKings is a "very ethical company," that it doesn't need regulation and that daily fantasy sports players can trust it not to cheat. He personally stood by the employee who in error or oversight posted inside information ahead of a Sunday football contest. “I don’t care if people give me all kinds of heat for it,” Robins said. “I had so many people tell me the simple thing to do is just fire him. I said, ‘It’s wrong.’” The incident raised questions about whether DraftKings employees had used inside information to gain an advantage in games they play on other daily fantasy sites. At this point, market leaders DraftKings and FanDuel have both banned such play. 
Boston University Will Put the Huntington Theater up for Sale 
Boston University plans to sell the 890-seat Huntington Theater, with a caveat that any buyer has to allow the Huntington Theater Company to continue using the facility until June 30, 2017. After that, it could be curtains for one of Boston's few theatric venues. Read more in the Boston Herald . 
Uniqlo Opens Friday in Faneuil Hall 
Japanese department store chain Uniqlo opens its Boston flagship store in Faneuil Hall, Friday. The company has operated a pop-up in Faneuil Hall for some time. The new store takes over a second-floor space next to the rotunda, formerly used for events. Read more in the Boston Herald .
